utterance.speaker: Nicole
utterance.content: Hi.

utterance.speaker: Nicole
utterance.content: And if I'm not?

utterance.speaker: Nicole
utterance.content: Oh, well, then never mind. Ted is a wonderful man, dad. He's the second greatest guy I ever met.

utterance.speaker: Nicole
utterance.content: Mm-hmm.

utterance.speaker: Reverend Bowden
utterance.content: Into this Holy estate, these two persons present now come to be joined. And so if any person may show just cause why they may not be joined together, let them speak now or forever hold their peace.

utterance.speaker: Reverend Bowden
utterance.content: That's what I like to hear. Do you, Theodore Philip Taylor, take Nicole Margaret Murray to be your wife, and promise before God and these witnesses to be her loving and faithful husband, in plenty and in want, in joy and in sorrow, in sickness and in health, so long as you both shall live?

utterance.speaker: Ted
utterance.content: I— I—

utterance.speaker: Nicole
utterance.content: This isn't funny, Ted.

utterance.speaker: Ted
utterance.content: Uh...

utterance.speaker: Nicole
utterance.content: Ted.

utterance.speaker: Reverend Bowden
utterance.content: Are you all right?

utterance.speaker: Nicole
utterance.content: Teddy.

utterance.speaker: Sam
utterance.content: Hey.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Hey.

utterance.speaker: Sam
utterance.content: What time is it?

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Happy time.

utterance.speaker: Sam
utterance.content: I’m still asleep.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Just think of this as a dream.

utterance.speaker: Sam
utterance.content: What about House?

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: I said a dream, not a nightmare.

utterance.speaker: Sam
utterance.content: He's in the next room.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Sound asleep.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I met the neighbors.

utterance.speaker: Police Officer
utterance.content: Sir, do you know this man?

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Hmm.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: I don't need a temporary. I need a permanent. Yesterday. Please do.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Good morning.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: Hardly. One of my P.A.s quit an hour ago, and I have to reshuffle next month's schedule.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: That's nothing. I woke up in the wrong bed this morning.

utterance.speaker: Nurse Jeffrey
utterance.content: Any bed you're in is the wrong one.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: That’s not what your mama said. Oh! Snap.

utterance.speaker: Nurse Jeffrey
utterance.content: I'll be going now. To Human Resources.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: He started it. It was the neighbor's kid's bed. Luckily, Esteban still likes sleeping with mommy.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: How drunk were you?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: About yea drunk.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: Are you okay? You shouldn't be drinking at all, much less—

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: You sound just like Esteban's mom.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: I need you in the clinic.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Sorry, I'm busy.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Tell me you have a case. You know, even if you don't.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: I have a case.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Sounds interesting. I'll take it. I owe you one. Now tell me you don't have a case.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: I really do have a case.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: We're even.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: You guys know how to honeymoon.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: This is Dr. House. Aphasia and syncope.

utterance.speaker: Nicole
utterance.content: He can't speak.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: "Aphasia" is Greek for loss of voice.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: We've ruled out infection, vocal cord damage, and stroke.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: A lot of guys syncope at the altar. It's Greek for "having the vapors."

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: We ruled out all the common causes of fainting: Low blood pressure, hypoglycemia, dehydration.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Don't say "ah."

utterance.speaker: Nicole
utterance.content: Do you know what it is?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Roll on your side and lift up your gown.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: There's one thing they didn't test for.

utterance.speaker: Nicole
utterance.content: A test for what?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Faking.

utterance.speaker: Ted
utterance.content: Ow!

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Test was positive.

utterance.speaker: Ted
utterance.content: I— I can— I can talk. I— I wasn't faking. My voice just came back right now.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Hey, I'm not the one you have to convince.

utterance.speaker: Nicole
utterance.content: I know he wasn't faking.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Well, if she's buying that, she might just be a keeper.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: What about the syncope?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Well, the—

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Is she buying this too?

utterance.speaker: Nicole
utterance.content: Why would he fake anything?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Kryo podia. It's Greek for "duh." Still, you get to keep the engagement ring.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: I don't think he was faking.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: That's because you're more gullible than I am. For instance, I don't believe that you called off your open marriage. I believe your wife called it off, and you called off telling her that you weren't calling it off. A guy doesn't just throw a golden ticket in the trash.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: The same way a guy doesn't give up a lucrative medical practice to come work for you?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: That's exactly why you dabble. You're compensating for your professional conquests with sexual ones.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: I'm not that predictable. For example, you're probably not expecting me to ask you out for dinner tonight.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: No, thanks.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: You won't even consider it?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I did, just very quickly.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: The truth is, since I called this thing off, my wife has been very grateful and I could do with a down night. If I go out with the boss, nobody can blame me.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Okay. If you bring your wife.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: No. That's the point. I need a little—

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: You're lying.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: I'm not lying.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Then I'm not going.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Okay. Fontina at 8:30.

utterance.speaker: Ted
utterance.content: You believe me, right?

utterance.speaker: Nicole
utterance.content: Of course I believe you.

utterance.speaker: Ted
utterance.content: Then let's do it. We'll tell a cab to take us to AC right now and get it done.

utterance.speaker: Nicole
utterance.content: You're serious? You just walked out of the emergency room.

utterance.speaker: Ted
utterance.content: Exactly. I walked out. I feel great.

utterance.speaker: Nicole
utterance.content: Well, we do have the clothes for it.

utterance.speaker: Nicole
utterance.content: Ted, what's wrong? Are you— what's wrong? Oh, my God. Can somebody help us? Please! Please hurry. Just breathe. Oh, my God.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: There's gotta be a better way to call off a wedding. A Tweet, for example.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Pleural effusion.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: You think his lung is faking it?

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: There's at least 200 ccs of fluid in there.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Okay, let's say all his symptoms are real. Explain how one of them suddenly went away without using the words "virgin" or "Mary."

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: If the pleural effusion's caused by something systemic, it could explain his other two symptoms. And so whether you believe him or not, all we have to figure out is what caused the PE.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: ER ruled out infection. Eosinophil count ruled out parasites.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: A medication he's not telling us about.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: You really don't trust this guy, do you?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I don't even trust the ER. Let's rule out infections ourselves. Tap his lungs, send cultures, run cytology for cancer, and check his blood pressure.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: We already—

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: This time, talk about nuptials while you do it. Check his home for everything else.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: He just moved in with his fiancee three months ago. Toxic exposure could take longer than that to manifest.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: You check his love nest. You two check his swinging bachelor pad.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: That somebody else now lives in?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I assume so.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Not the glass. No.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: The place looks like...1960s? Could have lead paint.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: You think a 27-year-old has pica?

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: If it gets us out of here before the owner comes back, yes.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: What'd you tell that cute physio?

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: That I changed my mind.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: No, you didn't. You're more nervous than usual.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Because this B and E has actual B.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: That's a suspended ceiling.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: What are you doing?

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: I want to see what's above it.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: More ceiling.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: Made of 40-year-old acoustic tile.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Asbestosis. I like it. I'll be in the car.

utterance.speaker: Cotter
utterance.content: What the hell?

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Uh, it's okay. We're doctors. Nobody was home, so—

utterance.speaker: Cotter
utterance.content: Well, I'm calling the police.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: Do you know Ted Taylor? He used to live here.

utterance.speaker: Cotter
utterance.content: Yeah. What about him?

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: He's our patient at Princeton Plainsboro.

utterance.speaker: Cotter
utterance.content: Is he okay?

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: We think he may have asbestosis from your ceiling tiles.

utterance.speaker: Cotter
utterance.content: They're not asbestos. I had 'em checked when I moved in. How sick is he?

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Is he a friend of yours?

utterance.speaker: Cotter
utterance.content: He was. Actually, he was my boyfriend for three years.

utterance.speaker: Ted
utterance.content: I'm not gay.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Really? 'Cause it would certainly explain the cold feet. Oh, and the boyfriend.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: So you're bisexual?

utterance.speaker: Ted
utterance.content: No, I'm straight. Cotter, the guy you met, he's gay. He had a crush on me. I left.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: After three years?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Well, it's possible. It doesn't mean you're gay just 'cause the guy you're sleeping with is.

utterance.speaker: Ted
utterance.content: We weren't sleeping together. What's this got to do with anything?

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Lung tap turned up mononucleosis. ER doesn't routinely test for it. It explains the PE and can be virtually asymptomatic.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: So we got to wondering, how does a 27-year-old get mono? You're a little old for the kissing disease, unless your immune system is compromised.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: If there's been any unprotected sex, we'll need to test for HIV.

utterance.speaker: Ted
utterance.content: There's been no sex of any kind.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Okay. I'll go test your fiancee for HIV. Is she the curious sort?

utterance.speaker: Ted
utterance.content: Wait. There may have been some contact, but I'm not gay.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Sodomy, one of the top ten most common household accidents.

utterance.speaker: Ted
utterance.content: I did a lot of stupid things, but I turned my life around. I'm as straight as any of you.

utterance.speaker: Ted
utterance.content: You don't have to believe me. I'm just saying you can test me... As long as you don't tell Nicole.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: What business is it of hers?

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: I don't see anything wrong with him marrying a straight woman.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: How about, it'll make them both miserable?

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Just like most straight marriages. He's got the right to life, liberty, and unhappiness, like the rest of us.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Absolutely no reason to look at me.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: I'm not saying it's a great choice. Just saying it's his choice.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: It has to be hers as well, which it can't be as long as she doesn't know he's gay.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Which is how it's gonna stay since we have no right to tell her.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: Like you've never bent the rules.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: You date guys. You date girls. I assume at some point, you're gonna make a choice.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: I don't lie about who I am.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Patients lying never bothered you before.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Patients weren't lying about their sexual orientation before.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: So you're only judgmental when it gets personal.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: Does it bother me that people hurt others because they're too weak to face the truth? Yeah. Sorry about that.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Tell me she's not looking at me.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: He's negative?

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Yep. Looks like being gay didn't make him sick.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: So maybe being straight did.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: The test was negative. No HIV.

utterance.speaker: Ted
utterance.content: I told you.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: What you didn't tell us is how you turned your life around. It can be pretty hard.

utterance.speaker: Ted
utterance.content: It was.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: Downright impossible on your own.

utterance.speaker: Ted
utterance.content: I talked to some people.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: It was more than just talk, wasn't it? I know this is personal stuff. I'm here to help you, not out you.

utterance.speaker: Ted
utterance.content: I had therapy.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: Conversion therapy. Went to a camp for three weeks of intensive rehabilitation. They injected him with emetics while he watched gay porn.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Apomorphine?

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: Or lithium chloride or cyclophosphamide. He doesn't know. And when that didn't work, they shot him up with male hormones.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: A chemical assault like that could explain the PE.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: And the ECT explains the rest.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: They gave him electroconvulsive therapy to make him straight?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: To zap the fabulous right out of him.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: Neural damage accounts for the aphasia.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: ECT doesn't cause neural damage.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Unless it was done at Dr. Liberace's he-man quackery camp. Run an EEG. See if they straightened him or just scrambled him.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Sorry. I completely forgot. My wife just started a ceramics class Tuesdays at 8:00. It's a half-hour drive from here. She won't be back till 10:30. She's taking it with her girlfriend Marly. She hopes to make a tea service. You want to call her?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: No need. I already texted her. And here she is now.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I think you're still seeing the physio. You've got a backup suit in your car. Don't want to be bringing home da stank.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Okay, yes, you're right, about everything. But please, House. Don't tell her.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Hi, Rachel.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Hi, Dr. House. I didn't know you'd be here. Hi, honey. Got your text, obviously.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I'm just leaving. I've got a ceramics class.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Really?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I love it. Even managed to talk Chris into signing up for one. Of course, he's in the beginners' class.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: You're in a ceramics class?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Friday nights, right?

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Friday nights. Sounded like fun.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: You should join Chris'.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: You know, I should.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Well, gotta go. Making a tea service.

utterance.speaker: Nicole
utterance.content: Hi, I must have fallen asleep in the lounge. What are they doing?

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: An EEG.

utterance.speaker: Nicole
utterance.content: What's it for?

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: We're looking for neurological damage that could have caused his symptoms.

utterance.speaker: Nicole
utterance.content: Damage from what?

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: A head trauma.

utterance.speaker: Nicole
utterance.content: He had an accident?

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: It wasn't an accident. It was before he met you.

utterance.speaker: Nicole
utterance.content: Well, what happened? Was he hospitalized?

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: You should ask him about it. They have the results.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Everything looks normal.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Look at this.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Beta waves are spiking.

utterance.speaker: Nicole
utterance.content: What's that mean?

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: I'm not sure.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: He's coding. Crash cart.

utterance.speaker: Nicole
utterance.content: What's happening to him?

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: He's having a heart attack.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: EKG showed no abnormalities.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: So what caused the arrest?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Four ways to stop a heart. Electrical problems, restricted blood flow, blood where it shouldn't be, shocks, blocks, or bleeds.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: I think that's three things.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: And cheating. Oh, no. Sorry. That's how you break a heart.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: I found a ceramics class in Trenton on Friday nights that was full so my wife couldn't join me. EP study ruled out shocks.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Now you just have to find some pottery by Taub. The lamer it looks, the better.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: So we'll do an angio to see if it's blocks or bleeds.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: You should be a doctor.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: I'm gonna check out this new lesbian bar tonight.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Your life is awesome.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: You want to come?

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: I was telling a 33-year-old woman that she has breast cancer.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: No, you weren't.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: How do you know?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Because if you were, you'd need to see the pain in her eyes so she could see the concern in yours. Why are you setting me up on dates with my team? Taub asking me out was quirky, but Thirteen doing it is a barking cat.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: I'm doing it to help you.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: By setting me up with a hottie that I can't sleep with? And Thirteen?

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: I've been spending more time with Sam. I know it's been hard on you. I figured if you had some company—

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I don't need your help.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Then consider it helping our neighbor's four-year-old.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I gave him a dollar. How much did you have to pay?

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Nothing. I just told them you might be feeling down and it was in their self-interest to keep you company. 100 bucks, Foreman held out for 2. House, I'm worried about you. You could have ended up in jail or worse.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Racking you with guilt. So I do something really stupid and you reward me. Read any parenting manual. That's not helping me. That's helping you.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Fine, I did it for me, for my relationship, out of pure self-interest.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Okay.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: You'll do it?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: For you.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Thank you.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: It's not gonna work, though.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Maybe. But how bad can a night out at a lesbian bar be?

utterance.speaker: Nicole
utterance.content: Hey. How are you doing?

utterance.speaker: Ted
utterance.content: Heart attack at 27.

utterance.speaker: Nicole
utterance.content: Um, they said you had a head trauma?

utterance.speaker: Ted
utterance.content: I fell off a stepladder and- -and hit my head. It was a stupid accident.

utterance.speaker: Nicole
utterance.content: An accident.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: We need to prep you for your angio.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Valium will help you relax.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: We're gonna run a line through your femoral artery.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Ted?

utterance.speaker: Nicole
utterance.content: He's having another heart attack?

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: I don't think so. His heart rate seems normal.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Are you okay? You weren't discussing wedding plans, were you?

utterance.speaker: Ted
utterance.content: No. I guess I just...

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Fainted.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: P.O.T.S. - Postural orthostatic tachycardia syndrome. BP plummets when he's upright, reverts to normal when he's lying down.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: He was lying down both times we took his blood pressure.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: Protracted hypotension could have induced his heart attack. Also explains the syncope.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: And his aphasia. He was upright, then you laid him down on the bed to test him. BP reverted to normal, voice came back, jabbing him with the needle had nothing to do with it.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: P.O.T.S. can be brought on by a viral or bacterial infection such as mono.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: So load him up with fludrocortisone.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: You didn't read your ceramics course description, did you?

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Yeah. You did?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: As I'm sure your wife did. So we all know they're doing a fourth of July theme. She'll be expecting something star-spangled.

utterance.speaker: Cotter
utterance.content: Nicole?

utterance.speaker: Nicole
utterance.content: Yes?

utterance.speaker: Cotter
utterance.content: Cotter Macklin. I'm an old friend of Ted's.

utterance.speaker: Nicole
utterance.content: Hi.

utterance.speaker: Cotter
utterance.content: How's he doing?

utterance.speaker: Nicole
utterance.content: Um, he had a heart attack.

utterance.speaker: Cotter
utterance.content: Oh, my God.

utterance.speaker: Nicole
utterance.content: They have him on some new meds. Really knocked him out.

utterance.speaker: Cotter
utterance.content: Well, how are you holding up?

utterance.speaker: Nicole
utterance.content: I'm okay. Thanks.

utterance.speaker: Cotter
utterance.content: Um, I brought this for him.

utterance.speaker: Nicole
utterance.content: That's his favorite thing in the whole world.

utterance.speaker: Cotter
utterance.content: I know.

utterance.speaker: Nicole
utterance.content: You weren't at the wedding, were you?

utterance.speaker: Cotter
utterance.content: No, I-I wasn't invited. Ted and I had a-a falling out.

utterance.speaker: Nicole
utterance.content: How did you know each other?

utterance.speaker: Cotter
utterance.content: Um, we met senior year of college. Yeah, we— we shared a house for a while.

utterance.speaker: Nicole
utterance.content: You were roommates?

utterance.speaker: Cotter
utterance.content: For three years.

utterance.speaker: Cotter
utterance.content: I'm— I'm sorry. I— I just miss him.

utterance.speaker: Nicole
utterance.content: I think you should leave.

utterance.speaker: Cotter
utterance.content: I shouldn't have done that.

utterance.speaker: Nicole
utterance.content: Now. Please?

utterance.speaker: Cotter
utterance.content: I hope he gets better.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: Hey, how are you feeling?

utterance.speaker: Ted
utterance.content: Hmm. Don't know yet

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Your numbers look good. We're gonna keep you on these meds.

utterance.speaker: Nicole
utterance.content: You had a visitor while you were asleep.

utterance.speaker: Ted
utterance.content: Oh yeah? Who?

utterance.speaker: Nicole
utterance.content: Cotter. Who is he?

utterance.speaker: Ted
utterance.content: I shared a house with him after college. I don't know why he would show up.

utterance.speaker: Nicole
utterance.content: That's it?

utterance.speaker: Ted
utterance.content: Yeah. Why? What did he say?

utterance.speaker: Nicole
utterance.content: I need to hear it from you, Ted.

utterance.speaker: Ted
utterance.content: One night, I got, really drunk and, I went to bed. And he came into my room. One thing led to another. The whole thing was a mistake.

utterance.speaker: Nicole
utterance.content: Are you saying you had sex with him?

utterance.speaker: Ted
utterance.content: I was drunk and confused.

utterance.speaker: Nicole
utterance.content: You're gay?

utterance.speaker: Ted
utterance.content: No! I thought, I was. I even, made up my mind to tell my family. I stood in front of the bathroom mirror, psyching myself up. All I could see was disgust. And that's when I realized, I didn't hate the thought of admitting I was gay because I was ashamed. I hated the thought because I wasn't gay. And that was the day I went to get help.

utterance.speaker: Nicole
utterance.content: So you're not gay?

utterance.speaker: Ted
utterance.content: They cured me, Nicole. That's what all the head trauma is about. I'm sorry I didn't tell you, but it's— it's all in the past now. It doesn't matter anymore.

utterance.speaker: Nicole
utterance.content: What is it?

utterance.speaker: Ted
utterance.content: Oh, oh my head!

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: He's got severe headaches.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: So do I. Should I call or raise with a double gutshot draw?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: No. What about infection?

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: That's what we're thinking. Cerebral infection would explain the headaches, could have caused P.O.T.S. If it's fungal, it could have spread to the heart.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I was talking about you. Has the little gent been wearing a tent?

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Remind me why that has anything to do with you.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: A distracted person makes a distracted professional.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: And destroying my marriage will help me focus.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Probably. Do a spinal tap. Run the CSF. Still talking about you. But you can do it on the patient, too, if you want.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: What about her?

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: The bartender?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: She's the only one who's not here for fun.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: Trust me, she's not straight.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: If your gaydar is so great, how come you didn't know about the patient till you met his boyfriend?

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: The guy walked in with his bride. It took me a while to rotate my dish. It's unbelievable what he's doing to her.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: You don't think he loves her?

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: He may love her, but he needs to have sex with other men.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Taub loves his wife, but he needs to have sex with other women.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: Yeah, it sucks what he's doing to her too, but it's hardly the same. To be faithful to his wife, our patient has to deny his identity. Taub just needs to—

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: to resist a biological imperative.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: It is easier to say no to dessert than to pretend you don't eat.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Says someone who's obviously never been on a diet.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: Oh, yeah. My life's a breeze.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: You're successful, smart, and you attract everything that moves. If you want to focus on the fact that you're not gonna see 50, that's your choice.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: You know what? I agree with you. My self-pity's optional. What about yours?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Yeah?

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: CSF was negative for infection, and his headaches are worse.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: We were just talking about you.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Please don't.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: It's not P.O.T.S., we're back to square one.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Not quite. You did a spinal tap, but the headaches got worse.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: We're maxing him out on morphine.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: He sprung a leak. He's losing CSF from the tap site.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: We made his headaches worse?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Just you, actually.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: That still wouldn't explain why he got the headaches in the first place.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: The low pressure in his brain caused the P.O.T.S., not the other way around. Patch the leak and top him up with artificial CSF.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: There. That should stop the leak.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: You should be feeling some relief soon.

utterance.speaker: Nicole
utterance.content: I spoke to my parents.

utterance.speaker: Ted
utterance.content: How are they doing?

utterance.speaker: Nicole
utterance.content: They're still worried.

utterance.speaker: Ted
utterance.content: Well, tell them not to be. Everything's gonna be okay.

utterance.speaker: Nicole
utterance.content: Ted?

utterance.speaker: Ted
utterance.content: What's happening?

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: He's stroking.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Both eyes are responsive.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Tell me your full name.

utterance.speaker: Ted
utterance.content: Theodore Philip Taylor.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: This isn't a stroke.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Then what is it?

utterance.speaker: Ted
utterance.content: What's happening to me?

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: It's really not P.O.T.S. We're really back to square one.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: So what's masquerading as a stroke? Voted the worst Halloween costume, by the way.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: MRA showed no problems with blood flow to the brain, rules out T.I.A.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Sarcoidosis?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Chest x-rays showed no hilar masses. Any luck with the pottery?

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Wasn't easy. Bought a suitably cruddy set of fife and drum napkin rings online. Scleroderma?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Skin's fine. A.N.A. was negative. So what did that set you back?

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Too much. I got into a bidding war with some lunatic. Histoplasmosis.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: EIA was clear. Hey, could have gone a lot higher than $215.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: You're kissmyasthma99?

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: What about MELAS? Mitochondrial encephalomyopathy, lactic acidosis, and stroke-like episodes.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: NILLAS. No. Idiot. Lactate. Levels. Are. Stable. We're missing something.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: We've run every test that makes sense, asked every question we can think of, gone over his history a dozen times.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: We know how much we can trust his history.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: If history is written by the victor, how do we find out what really happened?

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Talk to the loser.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Call the boyfriend. Let's get them all in the same room.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Or we could question them separately and not torture them.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Or we could get them all in the same room and get the truth.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Oh. Drinks are on me and Foreman tonight.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Can't. Pap smear.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: We don't want to do it either, but Wilson already paid us.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: It's gonna suck.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: I know.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Where and when?

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: Any incidents of dizziness? Seizures? Blackouts?

utterance.speaker: Nicole
utterance.content: Other than our wedding day.

utterance.speaker: Ted
utterance.content: Don't you think I would have told you if there were?

utterance.speaker: Cotter
utterance.content: My sister's birthday.

utterance.speaker: Ted
utterance.content: I was drunk.

utterance.speaker: Cotter
utterance.content: You had one Martini.

utterance.speaker: Ted
utterance.content: On an empty stomach.

utterance.speaker: Cotter
utterance.content: Look, he was just sitting on the couch, and then he— he— he fell over and that was it.

utterance.speaker: Ted
utterance.content: Well, once I slept it off, I was fine.

utterance.speaker: Cotter
utterance.content: Well, I stayed up that night checking on him every 15 minutes.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: What about sex?

utterance.speaker: Ted
utterance.content: Yes, I have sex with my girlfriend, because I'm not gay.

utterance.speaker: Nicole
utterance.content: We have sex.

utterance.speaker: Ted
utterance.content: Thank you.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: No problems?

utterance.speaker: Nicole
utterance.content: Um, well, there have been some...

utterance.speaker: Ted
utterance.content: Nic.

utterance.speaker: Nicole
utterance.content: Issues.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Erectile dysfunction?

utterance.speaker: Ted
utterance.content: Every guy has it sometimes.

utterance.speaker: Cotter
utterance.content: We never had that problem.

utterance.speaker: Ted
utterance.content: Gee, that must be because Ted doesn't like girls.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Or because it's vascular. I know we did an MRA, but arterial disease causing acute ischemia could explain the heart, neuro symptoms, and maybe even P.O.T.S.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: Might I suggest a diagnostic test?

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: The penile plethysmograph measures changes in blood flow in your penis. Tells us if there's a circulatory problem. You just need to be in the right... state.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: What's your pleasure?

utterance.speaker: Ted
utterance.content: I feel terrible. I-I don't think anything's gonna work.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: Then we'll have to give you a shot.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Where you don't want to get one.

utterance.speaker: Ted
utterance.content: Shot it is.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Nobody wants to follow that.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: The night just keeps getting better.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: To Wilson.

utterance.speaker: All
utterance.content: Wilson.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Everything looks fine.

utterance.speaker: Ted
utterance.content: You sure?

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: Medically, that's good news. Are you feeling feverish? You're sweating.

utterance.speaker: Ted
utterance.content: No. I feel lousy, but I don't know why I'm sweating.

utterance.speaker: Ted
utterance.content: What is it?

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: You're not sweating.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: You're lactating.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: If he can't tell his fiancee he's gay, how is he gonna tell her he's pregnant?

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: His therapists loaded him with hormones.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Male hormones don't make you lactate.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Except they could screw up your thyroid.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: That was over three months ago. We just started milking him last night.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: So something else screwed up his thyroid. Graves, Hashimoto's.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Nope. TSH was normal.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Pituitary tumor. Could also explain his libido and heart issues.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: And if the tumor's big enough, his headaches and syncope.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Except we— we cleared him for cancer.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Didn't say "cancer." Prolactinomas can be benign.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Check his prolactin level, then MRI his pituitary.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Sounds like you had fun last night.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: You believe Chase?

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: I believe Foreman. And they had fun with you. What happened?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I realized that they could be my friends.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: You're serious.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: And then I sobered up.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: You weren't that drunk. You managed to find your way into your own little bed last night.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I think I sleep better in rocket ship sheets.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: No, you want to blame this on the booze, but that's easy. Change is hard.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: And wisdom is knowing the difference between what you can change... And what you were born with.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: And cowardice is labeling what you don't want to change as innate.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: I was winning this argument.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Pituitary MRI—

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: was normal.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: How are the headaches?

utterance.speaker: Ted
utterance.content: Terrible.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Give me your head.

utterance.speaker: Ted
utterance.content: What the hell?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I know. It's the first time you've heard that sentence with a possessive pronoun.

utterance.speaker: Ted
utterance.content: Oh, wow, that— that's better.

utterance.speaker: Ted
utterance.content: Okay, enough.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: How cool is that? You have a Chiari malformation, a narrowing in the base of your skull that can cut off CSF flow. But it wasn't a problem until the ECT at breeder boot camp caused your brain to swell just enough to plug the opening. And when your brain pressed up against your pituitary, it signed you up for La Leche League. You still won't be pitching a tent for your lady, but that's just because, you know, she's a lady.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Its orthostatic effect was mimicking P.O.T.S.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: It also does an uncanny Christopher Walken. Unfortunately, if you treat it like P.O.T.S., it gets worse. So, as far as that goes, oops.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Proper treatment is surgery. We'll get you in right away.

utterance.speaker: Ted
utterance.content: So how did I get this thing?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Overbearing mother. Kidding. CM's congenital. Like so many other things, you were born that way.

utterance.speaker: Cotter
utterance.content: I thought you might be running low, so...

utterance.speaker: Ted
utterance.content: Thanks. I'm not coming back.

utterance.speaker: Cotter
utterance.content: Ted, this is a mistake.

utterance.speaker: Ted
utterance.content: I know you're hurting, and I'm sorry, but…

utterance.speaker: Cotter
utterance.content: I'm talking about hurting her.

utterance.speaker: Ted
utterance.content: I love her.

utterance.speaker: Cotter
utterance.content: Ted.

utterance.speaker: Ted
utterance.content: Thank you, for your support. We both really appreciate it.

utterance.speaker: Cotter
utterance.content: Good luck.

utterance.speaker: Ted
utterance.content: Hey. You know what I've been thinking? It's your birthday in three weeks. What do you say we rebook the church and make it a doubleheader?

utterance.speaker: Nicole
utterance.content: I don't know, Ted.

utterance.speaker: Ted
utterance.content: Less than a week ago we were standing at the altar, perfectly happy. Nothing's changed.

utterance.speaker: Nicole
utterance.content: Really?

utterance.speaker: Ted
utterance.content: I still love you. Do you still love me?

utterance.speaker: Nicole
utterance.content: Yes. But—

utterance.speaker: Ted
utterance.content: Then that's all that matters.

utterance.speaker: Nicole
utterance.content: But I think that you still love him.

utterance.speaker: Ted
utterance.content: I'm not gay. Nicole, I promise you.

utterance.speaker: Nicole
utterance.content: How can you promise me that?

utterance.speaker: Ted
utterance.content: Because I believe that we get to choose how we live our lives, and I've made my choice.

utterance.speaker: Nicole
utterance.content: So now, I have to make mine.

utterance.speaker: Ted
utterance.content: Nic.

utterance.speaker: Nicole
utterance.content: I'm sorry.

utterance.speaker: Ted
utterance.content: Nic. No. No.

utterance.speaker: Ted
utterance.content: I'm not saying good-bye.

utterance.speaker: Nicole
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: Ted
utterance.content: I want to marry you. I have to marry you. Nic!

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: It's Friday night.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: I called it off. For real this time.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Frees you up for the next one.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: One day at a time. Napkin rings. My way of saying thanks.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: For trying to wreck your marriage?

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: For trying to save it.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: And I get napkin rings?

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Expensive ones.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: I hired a replacement. For my P.A. She seems great.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Good work.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: You too. Your patient's going home tomorrow.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: He doesn't have a home.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: You want to grab a bite to eat?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: So Wilson got to you too?

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: No. This is just me.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Lucas?

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: Working late. I'm buying.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I'm not that hungry.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: Okay.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: I just want us to be friends.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Funny. That's the last thing I want us to be.
